rental_distribution.description: Power law (Zipfian) distribution for film rental frequency. alpha=1.0 creates 80/20 pattern where top 20% of films get 80% of rentals. Increase alpha (e.g., 1.5) for more extreme distribution.

new_movie_boost.description: New movie boost: only the top boost_percentage of new films (by film_id) released within days_to_boost get a weight multiplier (boost_factor). This reflects reality where not all new releases are equally popular. Example: 40% means ~40% of new films get 2x boost for 40 days, then linearly decay. Others follow normal power law immediately.

film_release_strategy._explanation: TWO-PHASE STRATEGY: (1) Market releases every week represent films available in the market, (2) Hot category purchases on specific weeks represent selective purchasing decisions
film_release_strategy.market_weekly_releases_description: Films released to market each week (added to film_releases table but NOT inventory). 20/week * 52 weeks = 1040 market releases annually
film_release_strategy.purchased_from_market_description: Selective purchasing from market based on hot_categories schedule - these represent purchasing decisions and are added to inventory

aggressive.description: Aggressive inventory growth across all genres

stable.description: Stable inventory growth with balanced genre distribution

seasonal.description: Stable growth focused on seasonally appropriate genres
